intro: Scolopia hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan scolopia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Scolopia hainanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
